resource.chars: These are moisture, heat, dryness and cold.
Heat and moisture devote their attention
To conserving and maintaining life,
But heat cannot prevent itself
From destroying and lessening moisture
Without ceasing and in all ways,
In the same way as oil destroys the wick
Until the lamp becomes dry.
Then the lamp loses its light.
It is in this manner
That natural heat destroys
Moisture, and hastens to do so.
Dryness also kills moisture,
And cold awaits nothing but death,
Which comes faster than walking.
From these four qualities, Nature formed
Four carnal complexions
Full of great antagonism,
Of which the first is phlegmatic,
And then sanguine and then choleric
And the fourth is melancholy.
From these four was human life,
Founded, as Nature
Proportions and measures them
In natural bodies that have souls.
Phlegm is common in children and women.
Blood comes to demand its rent
At fifteen years until approximately thirty
And afterwards comes lady Bile
Who holds school until sixty years,
Then comes melancholy, quickly,
Who joins herself to sadness
Through old age which loses
Appetite for games because she feels the earth below.
And even though women and men
Suffer various pains in great number,
And many torments in their youth,
Nevertheless in old age
They have more pain and bad periods,
As it follows reason.
They become disagreeable,
Full of mucous, scabs and eyes full of rheum,
Tumors and cough and gout,
And many other illnesses make them suffer.
This is why sadness strongly assaults
The end of man and woman’s life in old age.
The same is true, if I am not mistaken,
Of the world,
For it is made of four antagonistic elements,
The world and its organization.
These are fire, air, water and earth,
Between which there are many wars,
For they have very different natures,
And are differently made and have opposite wishes.
Fauvel, I tell you that at first
The world was phlegmatic,
And the people who were there,
Because of the phlegm many of them had,
Were very heavy and weighty,
Sleepy, stupid and taciturn.
Afterwards the world became sanguine,
When David the prophet came,
For at that moment intelligence was liberated
Which phlegm had covered before.
And then the world came to understand
That in the Virgin, God would come
To take on blood and flesh in order to redeem
Those whom Eve had conquered.
And then the world became choleric,
When God decided to be born from the Virgin,
For then the world was hot and dry,
When he in whom all goodness abounds
Sent dew from the skies
Which was so desired;
Then the clouds rained with happiness,
Which moistened our drought.
But now the world has come
Into great old age and has become
Very full of melancholy.
And this is towards the end of its life.
Melancholy, I dare to say it,
Is the worst of the complexions.
It is of a terrestrial nature,
So it must be cold and dry.
And the world is cold and dry,
Full of all kinds of evil and sin.
It does not care to amuse itself,
For it feels the earth too much.
It only wishes to acquire earth.
For this reason, misfortune and war result from it.
There is no joy or festivity there.
All parts of the earth are in a storm,
And it is truly reasonable,
For, if Scripture does not lie,
Signs are appearing that we must be close
To the time in which
The enemy of Christianity must be born,
He through whom all abundance
Of evil must come into the world
At the time when it must come to an end.
Fauvel, you came forward
At a fast trot and a slow one,
In order to prepare for your master
The places where he will be received.
You are the courier of Antichrist,
His messenger and his harbinger!
You have prepared his hotel well,
Both for winter and for summer.
You are an excellent messenger for him.
You are made only in order to go first
To prepare for his household.
You know very well how to understand and take care of this!
You have looked for so many inns for him
And acquired so many people everywhere,
Who possess neither faith nor love nor truth,
That I tell you without lying
That it is time that your master come.
You have combed so much with your beautiful comb
And brushed so much with your brushes
That your sons and daughters are everywhere.
Fauvel, you should be killed
Since you have such an evil lord!
Antichrist is your true lord.
You are bad and he is worse!
You are his valet and his messenger,
And you believed that you would marry
Fortune, the lady!
I am not a wife for such a lackey!
When I wish, I will make you
Fall and I will leave you impoverished.
I did not place great honor in you
Because I love or value you,
But rather through the divine order
Which makes everything balance out.
It is true that you will reign for a little while
And you will accomplish a great deal of what you desire,
But nevertheless you must know
That however much you may possess,
I will inflict suffering and shame often
On several people in your lineage.”
